title: Supports (multiple categories so be ready to read a lolt, plz dont tl;dr)
body:
ok, firstly i must say im a sion support main with 2 placement games left, so dont call me a support hater when i speak of my first argument

first argument, the supports, who dont really support, ive had innocent versions of this, and people just going out of their way for glory. Most commonly seen in the recent influx of lux players going full ap lux no support item, so here is my statement. EXHAUST DOES NOT MAKE YOU A SUPPORT. taking a support item and even teleport works as a support, and please answer me this while im at it, why take ignite as a support *oh but then they get less heal and its not for ks* if so why not have support take heal and adc take ignite

second argument, just because im the support, doesnt mean i cant be in command, or in situations of some flame'y adc's, right. more adc's should hear this. Supports can become in charge if situations hold, i have had many a game of this recently where the adc understood about my early engage power, and they agree to go along with my early plan at least once, and if i suceed they trust me and follow my lead, if i fail i follow the adc, knowing if the support can take command can tell u who decides wether to fall back from a gank, engage, etc.

my final argument. this argument isnt as big but i would like to ask two things, one, how many off meta support feel so effective they should be meta, and who do you prefer as a support, sion or leona

replies.body:
Ok so , something you have to remember here is that they are only supporting you through the laning phase and peeling for you through out the rest of the game ( they will do this for other players also and they should do the same for you.. ie: teamwork ), so let use your lux example , has slow,snare good poke and a shield for you and good dmg..... imo they should at least buy sightstone apart from that lux is fine. 

As for summoner spells id prefer them to have {{summoner:3}}  but they can really run what ever they like,  really you are trying to win the lane to help get map control to then win the game so even if they take {{summoner:14}} and are getting the kills its not the end of the world, as they are actually going to build dmg and do dmg , not like a full tank build sup that may never die they arnt going to be able to do much with those kills as u wont have the dmg to follow it up early.

as for lane control , before the game even begins im asking my adc or sup if they want to play def or aggressive and base my picks off enemy champ select and my team picks and how they wanna play the lane , as a supp you can make the calls if your a champ with snares and stuns so your adc know when u are going for cc, the adc can do the same if they know they have the dmg to win at certain lvs and call targets for you to lock down or tank. so both adc and sup can call the lane its just you have to be open to communicate.

i thought i communicated with my adc well, u bring it to another level, and lol i almost never take exhaust as support sion, always tp XD, FACE FOR LIFE, still tho, this is how the adc's should think of us, not the person to blame when they cant blame jungler

Lol its not really another level , im just chill about it and I want to make it work so we have the best chance of winning even if we dont i always play to have fun and so far its work very well for me.

You should try {{summoner:3}} on sion another slow in the bot lane for you could make a big difference more CC should always be welcome.

I personal think blaming others no matter what lane your playing in will do nothing to help, just leaves everyone agitated.
Does anyone think that yelling and cursing at the person trying to help you will make them want to help you anymore than they already are.
Best way to solve this issues is if they are annoying you at all , just ask them to sit back and farm the lane  or just to chill and make sure they dont engage on the adc.  Also dont forget you have a mute button for the keyboard warriors who cant handle constructive criticism. ( id avoid giving it in game, lol generally just makes them worse )

i do use exhaust for warming up, as it safety consistency, but when im confident that i will be able to clear the botlane with the cost of my life a few times during laning phase, teleport helps me put extra push in bot  lane, or save the top laner when a tp backdoor goes wrong (i usually tp with em if i can XD)

if you take ignite on support, you are playing for the laning phase or are playing against healy supports or anticipating an enemy adc to have warlords and lifesteal. If you take ignite on support, unlike with midlaners where ignite is the finishing move, you need to know exactly when a fight is an all-in and then drop ignite immediately at the start of the fight, to prevent lifesteal or healing and also to reduce the chances that ignite will be the final tick since the kill is generally better off on the Adc.

Supports who drop ignite as a finisher to ks are the worst, but ignite is definitely an option worth considering as a support, especially if the enemy team lacks mobile bruisers (if the enemy team has irelia, jax, riven or kled you'll probably need exhaust) and you are fairly confident you can preform during the early game with your support champ.
Lux is a viable bot support when you dont have an Ap in your team. and you can go full ap, Warding is team exercise.
with full ap lux, idc what ur full ap build is, as long as u get support item during laning phase, and if we request it, a redemption

although arguably as a someone who sometimes plays tank toplaner, if we're lacking in the AP department and the only ap we have is lux for the teamcomp (low elo teamcomps are more often than not 100% AD), redemption is probably better off in my inventory. Yes, she does get a shielding bonus but right now she needs magic pen more. Redemption has okayish stats for a tank item and since I'm the tank, I decide where we'll be fighting, and since I'm deciding that, I can make use of the redemption just the same.

In situations where we lack AP, I'd prefer the lux to run something like this: 
{{item:2301}} {{item:3165}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3020}}
see how this basically a midlaner's build? yeah well it is, because since we have no AP, come lategame she's worth protecting far more than any of our AD assassins. And if the adc was bad at csing and our lux still managed to pop off from assist gold and roams, then she might even be worth more than our adc through the midgame; though it depends on who has more gold and damage at the moment.

the support is there for early laning phase, but once laning phase it's over, it transitions into more about what the champion is, rather than the role they were given, are they a frontline tank like leona or braum? are they a poke mage like lux or zyra? are they a diver like nautilus or alistair? are they a champion who makes picks like blitzcrank or thresh? are they shields/heals and defensive peel like janna or nami?

The support isn't some waterboy for the team the entire game, the support is only there to ensure the adc gets safely though laning phase with as much gold as possible with as much gold as possible and that dragon and botside stays warded (and also try to get their adc first towerblood I guess). The support has no required responsibilities after that, they don't have to stick with the adc, moreover, it's more that the adc should start to hang around mid and continue to farm up in the safety of the midlane (sidelanes become more dangerous when you get to the middle and lategame) or if their damage is needed, stick with the support when the support roams around to skirmishes.
you are a lux support i would love to have, some just ks without support item, idc wether support item or ward

haha don't get me wrong, if we need AP I'd generally play things like morgana or zilean (looking to buy zyra maybe but leona is someone I've really wanted for a while too) because I'm really bad at lux, and I typically try to stick to more traditional supports like alistair, janna, blitzcrank, ect...
i havent seen those supports in forever... (alistair, janna, blitzcrank) its almost entirely thresh, every ranked game, thresh support, if not its leona support,
